Spatial Microsimulation Urban Metabolism (SMUM)¶

Author:Dr. M. Esteban Munoz H. <emunozh@gmail.com>
Version:0.1
Date:2017-10-27

Aim of this Documentation¶

This documentations aims to describe the main rationale behind the development of this python library and to present an overview of the main modules and functions implemented on the library.

The python library is composed of two main components:

  1. An Urban Metabolism sections that aims to balance all resources flows of city systems at an aggregated level (i.e. city-level) and;
  2. A Spatial Microsimulation section. The Spatial Microsimulation modules constructs a synthetic city and allocates consumption values to micro-level agents.

For a complete exmple please refere to the following ipython notebook
